name: Lucky?
statement: A ticket is a string consisting of six digits. A ticket is considered lucky if the sum of the first three digits is equal to the sum of the last three digits. Given a ticket, output if it is lucky or not. Note that a ticket can have leading zeroes.
inputFormat: The first line of the input contains an integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \leq t \leq 10^3$$$) â€” the number of testcases. The description of each test consists of one line containing one string consisting of six digits.
outputFormat: Output $$$t$$$ lines, each of which contains the answer to the corresponding test case. Output " YES " if the given ticket is lucky, and " NO " otherwise. You can output the answer in any case (for example, the strings " yEs ", " yes ", " Yes " and " YES " will be recognized as a positive answer).
